RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN ? Executive Summary
Pepsi Cola Bottling Company of Ft. Lauderdale-Palm Beach, Inc.
7305 Garden Street
Riviera Beach, FL  33404-3407
Palm Beach County

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at your facility: This facility adheres to all applicable federal, state, and local requirements for anhydrous ammonia storage. If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to notify 911 (emergencies) or the City of Riviera Beach Dispatcher (non-emergencies) at (561) 845-4123 and request response to the situation.  Additional emergency response can be obtained through the Palm Beach County HazMat Team, if necessary.

A description of your facility and the regulated substances handled. The Pepsi Cola Bottling Company of Fort Lauderdale-Palm Beach, Inc. (Pepsi) facility manufactures soft drink products. The facility consists of a 180,000-square foot operations building situated on approximately ten acres. The site is enclosed by a chain-link fence to prevent unauthorized entry. A maximum of 16,000 pounds of ammonia is stored at the Pepsi facility. The anhydrous ammonia is used as a refrigerant during the manufacturing process. It is contained in one, 800-gallon (4,500 pounds) cylinder and associated refrigeration system pipes, pumps, and receivers. The refrigeration system is a closed loop system; therefore, ammonia is not released during normal operations. Approximately 2,500 pounds of ammonia is added to the system annually. 

The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps. The ammonia system is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with engineering standards associated with the refrigeration industry. The facility completes daily preventative maintenance and contracts a licensed ammonia refrigeration contractor to perform detailed monthly preventative maintenance. The facility?s prevention program also includes employee training. Operators receive both clas

sroom and on the job training. 

Pepsi has safety programs in place to prevent accidents, as well as respond to minor accidents, should they occur. Pepsi?s safety and hazard preventio programs include the following:

Risk Management Program
Process Safety Management
Hazard Communication
Lockout/Tagout
Confined Space Entry

Five-year accident history. The Pepsi facility has never had an accident involving ammonia that caused deaths, serious injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place. 

The emergency response program. In the event of an emergency involving the ammonia system, it is our policy to notify 911 or the City of Riviera Beach Dispatcher at (561) 845-4123 and request response to the situation.  Additional emergency response can be obtained through the Palm Beach County HazMat Team, if necessary.  We have discussed this policy with the City of Riviera Beach Fire Department.
